text: Prepare the halogen oven. Put the higher level stand in place. Most halogen ovens work best when there is the most airflow both above and below the food. Wash the potatoes. Remove any imperfections. Pierce the potatoes. Poke a fork into various spots of each potato. Turn the temperature on the halogen oven to 200ºC.  Brush each potato with olive oil. Place in the oven evenly spaced apart. Do not have any potatoes touching. Cook for 45 minutes. Test when the cooking ends. If they need more time, try another 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from the oven when done. Use tongs to lift out of the oven. Cut open the tops of each potato. Push a fork into the flesh and mash it around. Add a dollop of butter. Season with salt and pepper. Add anything else you'd like, such as grated cheese, baked beans, chopped tomatoes, etc. Serve.
